alert.note: Alert for Logan; Polk; Scott; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 2:26AM CST until January 01 at 4:50AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Yell County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Logan County in western Arkansas... Northern Polk County in western Arkansas... Southeastern Scott County in western Arkansas... * Until 450 AM CST. * At 226 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 to 3 inches of rain have fallen, particularly over eastern Scott and western Yell counties. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area in the next few hours. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Russellville, Mena, Danville, Dardanelle, Hatfield, Cardiff, Gravelly, Stonehouse Recreation Area, Fourche Valley, Mena Intermountain Airport, Polk County Fairgrounds, Queen Wilhelmina State Park, Mountain Fork, Mosley, Mt Nebo State Park, Lake Dardanelle, Lake Dardanelle State Park, Belleville, Cove and Havana. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
